results.title: Seminar with Ray Harryhausen
results.brief_description: A tape recording of a seminar at the Cinemedia Treasury Theatre with Ray Harryhausen sponsored by The Brisbane International Animation Festival. Ray Harryhausen is a much acclaimed cult figure and celebrated artist and has influenced large bodies of work in the film canon as a whole. His contributions to stop-motion animation have been the inspiration for an entire generation of animators and special effects artists. In 1992, Ray Harryhausen was awarded the Gordon E. Sawyer Academy Award for special achievement from the Academy of Motion Picture Arts & Sciences. As the presenter of the award, Tom Hanks remarked, "some say Citizen Kane is the greatest motion picture of all time, others say it’s Casablanca, for me the greatest picture of all time is JASON AND THE ARGONAUTS." Ray is best known for his work with dinosaurs in ONE MILLION YEARS BC AND THE VALLEY OF GWANGI, the battling skeleton armies in JASON AND THE ARGONAUTS, and the Sinbad series, THE SEVENTH VOGAGE OF SINBAD, THE GOLDEN VOYAGE OF SINBAD and SINBAD AND THE EYE OF THE TIGER. The seminar includes a presentation of his early puppet work, highlights from some of his feature films, display of animation models, pre-production drawings, Q & A and autograph sessions.

results.title: Selling America. - [Ed. version]
results.creator_credit: General Motors and Jam Handy Organization
results.brief_description: A dramatisation of Benjamin Franklin’s principle of human association as applied to modern salesmanship. The following rules for successful selling are suggested: Get the prospect talking; don’t argue but be pleasant and helpful; agree with the customer, answering “yes…, but…”; don’t contradict and avoid being too positive; make the most use of time, bringing points of direct interest to the customer with other points about the product. An edited version.

results.title: Self defence by plants
results.brief_description: A study of the various self-protective characteristics which are found among plants, including the early seed case, the bud scales and leaf hairs, and the different methods of protection used by leaves and flowers against damage by rain and animals.

results.title: Self-portrait. Parts 1-5
results.brief_description: An anthology of scenes from memorable National Film Board films produced during the years from 1939 to 1960. Text on the screen identifies the film and its makers before each excerpt is shown, and the commentator notes the significant characteristics of each film’s style and subject.

results.title: Self-help
results.brief_description: Villagers in Malaya, living in widely separated huts open to attack by terrorists, clear a new site and move their village to an area more easily protected by police and their newly formed Home Guard unit.

results.title: Selections from the Christmas Oratorio by J.S. Bach
results.creator_credit: David Bairstow, Peter Jones and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: The Montreal Bach Choir under the direction of George Little has sung in many countries. This film presents the choir in one of its most distinguished performances with guest soloists Elizabeth Benson Guy, soprano; Maureen Forrester, contralto; Glenn Schnittke, tenor; Jan Simons, bass; James Ranti, trumpet; and Calvin Sieb, concertmaster.

results.title: Selection interview. No. 3
results.creator_credit: Ian Woolf, Tony Matthews and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Interaction”.
Part 4 of a series of films for managers. Based on a management selection interview, mounted as a special exercise with the Manchester Business School. Shows the selection panel’s final assessment of the candidate. Includes a review of the exercise. Introduced by Brian Redhead.

results.title: Selection interview. No. 2
results.creator_credit: Ian Woolf, Tony Matthews and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Interaction”.
Part 3 of a series fo films for managers. Based on a management selection interview mounted as a special exercise with the Manchester Business School. Contains a planned break in the interview, during which the candidate and a selection panel make their interim assessments of each other’s performance. Introduced by Brian Redhead.
